div1.note:
Buffalo Bill's Wild West and Congress of Rough Riders.
of the World.
Col. W. F. Cody. (Buffalo Bill), President.
Nate Salsbury. Vice-President & Manager.
John M. Burke. General Manager.
Jule Keen, Treasurer. /
div1.p: In reply to your letter about Millis & Co3 and others from Red Lodge4. I sent Alger on the 16th Sep- $5.000 asking him to pay all Red Lodge debts4- since then I have telegraphed him three times and asked him to answer at my expense if he had paid them— Not a word can I get out of him. If our Co gets into trouble it will be Algers neglect— for he has never called on me for money and failed to get it—

back.note: Note 1: Buffalo Bill's Wild West performed in Dubuque, Iowa, on September 28, 1896.
Note 2: The year is not inscribed by Cody but is 1896.
Note 3: Orville E. Millis (1857-1935) established a wholesale and retail store in Red Lodge, Montana, in 1887. Shoshone Irrigation Company purchased goods from Millis.
Note 4: "Others from Red Lodge" (Montana) and "Red Lodge debts" refer to the suppliers and the money owed them by Shoshone Irrigation Company.
